title: What song includes the lyric, 'You grab me by the heart and take me by the hand'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The song Oh Mickey by Toni Basil was a one hit wonder topping the charts in 1982. The song contains the lyrics: Oh, Mickey, what a pity you don't understandYou take me by the heart and you take me by the handOh, Mickey, you're so pretty, can't you understand?It's guys like you, Mickey

Here she is in all her splendor: link http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-3145896178321750463&q=toni+basil&total=563&start=0&num=10&so=0&type=search&plindex=0 Here is the most interesting part of Antonias life and it has nothing to do with anyone named Mickey. " Basil has appeared in the movies Easy Rider (as prostitute Mary, the brunette) and Five Easy Pieces, on television (including episodes of Laverne & Shirley and Baywatch), and has worked as a choreographer for movies such as American Graffiti, The Rose, Legally Blonde, the Beach Party series produced by AIP, as well as the The Monkees' cult film Head (in which she appeared as the (unbilled) dancer in the "Daddy's Song" sequence). In addition to her appearance in Head, she appeared in Village of the Giants, the cult film Rockula with Thomas Dolby and the 1987 B-Movie Slaughterhouse Rock. " link The Authorized Site: Agency Contact
